snippet: A formal description of Luigi Dallapiccola’s one-act “Il Prigioniero,” a bleak 12-tone opera about a despairing prisoner during the Spanish Inquisition, might not sound like a crowd pleaser.
lead_paragraph: A formal description of Luigi Dallapiccola’s one-act “Il Prigioniero,” a bleak 12-tone opera about a despairing prisoner during the Spanish Inquisition, might not sound like a crowd pleaser.
